info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 13 at 12:28PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A line of gusty showers will impact portions of north central Berkshire, northeastern Albany, southern Washington, Rensselaer and southwestern Bennington Counties through 115 PM EDT... At 1227 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a line of gusty showers over Cohoes, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Center Brunswick around 1235 PM EDT. Grafton around 1255 PM EDT. Hoosick Falls around 110 PM EDT. Bennington and Pownal around 115 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Bleecker Stadium, Albia, North Hancock, Johnsonville, Hoosick, Best, East Pittstown, Brunswick, White Oaks and Peters Four Corners. This includes the following highways... Interstate 90 between exits 9 and 5. Interstate 87 near exit 23. Interstate 787 between exits 1 and 9. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
